intro: Hypseocharis bilobata, commonly known as the two-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, adapting to the cold and arid conditions of its native range. Hypseocharis bilobata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
